intro: Lilaeopsis lineata, commonly known as the linear leek grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and marshes. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Lilaeopsis lineata is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ecological role in supporting insect populations.
